text: Kajetan Kovič (21 October 1931 – 7 November 2014) was a Slovene poet, writer, translator, and journalist. Kovič was born in Maribor, Yugoslavia. Kovič started writing poetry in high school, and he published his first poetry in 1948. Kovič also wrote political poetry, such as a poem in honor of Josip Broz Tito.Kovič, Kajetan. 1980. "Tito." Javna tribuna 20(184): 7. He established himself as a translator of German, French, Czech, Hungarian, Croatian, Serbian, and Russian poetry into Slovene. He also translated the poems that France Prešeren wrote in German into Slovene. Kovič died on 7 November 2014 in Ljubljana, Slovenia, aged 83.Kos, David, & Deja Crnović. 2014. "Umrl je pesnik in pisatelj Kajetan Kovič." Siol.net (7 Nov.). ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Slovenian poets Category:Slovenian journalists
title: Kajetan Kovič
